This account bears the admin role (for the granted role). Expected in cases where the role was granted using the internal {AccessControl-_grantRole}."},"RoleRevoked(bytes32,address,address)":{"details":"Emitted when `account` is revoked `role`. `sender` is the account that originated the contract call:   - if using `revokeRole`, it is the admin role bearer   - if using `renounceRole`, it is the role bearer (i.e. `account`)"},"Unpaused(address)":{"details":"Emitted when the pause is lifted by `account`."},"Upgraded(address)":{"details":"Emitted when the implementation is upgraded."}},"kind":"dev","methods":{"addManager(address)":{"details":"Adds a new manager","params":{"newManager":"Address of the new manager"}},"createAllocation(address,uint256)":{"details":"Creates a new allocation and assign tokens","params":{"amount":"Amount of tokens to allocate","beneficiary":"Address to receive the allocation"},"returns":{"_0":"allocationId Unique identifier for the allocation"}},"createAllocationV2(address,uint256)":{"details":"Creates a new allocation and tracks it in V2 counter","params":{"amount":"Total amount of tokens to allocate","beneficiary":"Address to receive allocated tokens"},"returns":{"_0":"allocationId Unique identifier for the allocation"}},"executeAirdrop(address[],uint256[])":{"details":"Executes an airdrop to multiple addresses","params":{"amounts":"Array of token amounts to distribute","beneficiaries":"Array of addresses to receive tokens"},"returns":{"_0":"airdropId Unique identifier for the airdrop"}},"getAllManagers()":{"details":"Returns all addresses assigned the MANAGER_ROLE"},"getAllocationById(uint256)":{"details":"Returns allocation details from TokenVault","params":{"allocationId":"ID of the allocation to check"},"returns":{"amount":"The allocated amount","beneficiary":"The beneficiary address","revoked":"Whether the allocation has been revoked"}},"getAllocationsForBeneficiary(address)":{"details":"Returns all allocations for a beneficiary","params":{"beneficiary":"Address to check allocations for"},"returns":{"_0":"allocationIds Array of allocation IDs for the beneficiary"}},"getRoleAdmin(bytes32)":{"details":"Returns the admin role that controls `role`. See {grantRole} and {revokeRole}. To change a role's admin, use {_setRoleAdmin}."},"getTotalAllocatedV2()":{"details":"Returns the total amount allocated through V2","returns":{"_0":"The total amount allocated using V2 functions"}},"getVersion()":{"details":"Returns the current version number","returns":{"_0":"The version number (2 for V2)"}},"grantRole(bytes32,address)":{"details":"Grants `role` to `account`. If `account` had not been already granted `role`, emits a {RoleGranted} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role. May emit a {RoleGranted} event."},"hasRole(bytes32,address)":{"details":"Returns `true` if `account` has been granted `role`."},"initialize(address)":{"details":"Initializes the contract replacing the constructor for upgradeable contracts","params":{"_ttnToken":"Address of the TTNToken contract"}},"initializeV2()":{"custom:oz-upgrades-validate-as-initializer":"","details":"Initializes V2 functionality This is called during the upgrade process"},"isManager(address)":{"details":"Returns whether an address is an admin or manager","params":{"account":"Address to check"},"returns":{"_0":"bool True if the address is either a super admin or a manager"}},"pause()":{"details":"Pauses vault operations"},"paused()":{"details":"Returns true if the contract is paused, and false otherwise."},"proxiableUUID()":{"details":"Implementation of the ERC-1822 {proxiableUUID} function. This returns the storage slot used by the implementation. It is used to validate the implementation's compatibility when performing an upgrade. IMPORTANT: A proxy pointing at a proxiable contract should not be considered proxiable itself, because this risks bricking a proxy that upgrades to it, by delegating to itself until out of gas. Thus it is critical that this function revert if invoked through a proxy. This is guaranteed by the `notDelegated` modifier."},"reduceAllocation(uint256,uint256)":{"details":"Reduces an allocation amount","params":{"allocationId":"ID of the allocation to reduce","amount":"Amount to reduce by"},"returns":{"_0":"success Whether the reduction was successful"}},"removeManager(address)":{"details":"Removes an manager","params":{"manager":"Address of the manager to remove"}},"renounceRole(bytes32,address)":{"details":"Revokes `role` from the calling account. Roles are often managed via {grantRole} and {revokeRole}: this function's purpose is to provide a mechanism for accounts to lose their privileges if they are compromised (such as when a trusted device is misplaced). If the calling account had been revoked `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must be `callerConfirmation`. May emit a {RoleRevoked} event."},"revokeAllocation(uint256)":{"details":"Revokes an allocation","params":{"allocationId":"ID of the allocation to revoke"},"returns":{"_0":"success Whether the revocation was successful"}},"revokeRole(bytes32,address)":{"details":"Revokes `role` from `account`. If `account` had been granted `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role. May emit a {RoleRevoked} event."},"supportsInterface(bytes4)":{"details":"See {IERC165-supportsInterface}."},"unpause()":{"details":"Unpauses vault operations"},"upgradeToAndCall(address,bytes)":{"custom:oz-upgrades-unsafe-allow-reachable":"delegatecall","details":"Upgrade the implementation of the proxy to `newImplementation`, and subsequently execute the function call encoded in `data`. Calls {_authorizeUpgrade}. Emits an {Upgraded} fcf5cb5b0d9bf9aa6f320a8b","dweb:/ipfs/QmarDJ5hZEgBtCmmrVzEZWjub9769eD686jmzb2XpSU1cM"]},"node_modules/@openzeppelin/contracts/utils/introspection/IERC165.sol":{"keccak256":"0x79796192ec90263f21b464d5bc90b777a525971d3de8232be80d9c4f9fb353b8","license":"MIT","urls":["bzz-raw://f6fda447a62815e8064f47eff0dd1cf58d9207ad69b5d32280f8d7ed1d1e4621","dweb:/ipfs/QmfDRc7pxfaXB2Dh9np5Uf29Na3pQ7tafRS684wd3GLjVL"]}},"version":1}

createAllocation(address,uint256).details: Creates a new allocation and assign tokens

returns._0: allocationId Unique identifier for the allocation

createAllocationV2(address,uint256).details: Creates a new allocation and tracks it in V2 counter

params.amount: Total amount of tokens to allocate

returns._0: allocationId Unique identifier for the allocation

executeAirdrop(address[],uint256[]).details: Executes an airdrop to multiple addresses

params.amounts: Array of token amounts to distribute
params.beneficiaries: Array of addresses to receive tokens

returns._0: airdropId Unique identifier for the airdrop

getAllManagers().details: Returns all addresses assigned the MANAGER_ROLE

params.allocationId: ID of the allocation to check

returns.revoked: Whether the allocation has been revoked

getAllocationsForBeneficiary(address).details: Returns all allocations for a beneficiary

returns._0: allocationIds Array of allocation IDs for the beneficiary

getRoleAdmin(bytes32).details: Returns the admin role that controls `role`. See {grantRole} and {revokeRole}. To change a role's admin, use {_setRoleAdmin}.

getTotalAllocatedV2().details: Returns the total amount allocated through V2

returns._0: The total amount allocated using V2 functions

grantRole(bytes32,address).details: Grants `role` to `account`. If `account` had not been already granted `role`, emits a {RoleGranted} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role. May emit a {RoleGranted} event.

initialize(address).details: Initializes the contract replacing the constructor for upgradeable contracts

initializeV2().details: Initializes V2 functionality This is called during the upgrade process

isManager(address).details: Returns whether an address is an admin or manager

returns._0: bool True if the address is either a super admin or a manager

paused().details: Returns true if the contract is paused, and false otherwise.

proxiableUUID().details: Implementation of the ERC-1822 {proxiableUUID} function. This returns the storage slot used by the implementation. It is used to validate the implementation's compatibility when performing an upgrade. IMPORTANT: A proxy pointing at a proxiable contract should not be considered proxiable itself, because this risks bricking a proxy that upgrades to it, by delegating to itself until out of gas. Thus it is critical that this function revert if invoked through a proxy. This is guaranteed by the `notDelegated` modifier.

params.allocationId: ID of the allocation to reduce

returns._0: success Whether the reduction was successful

params.manager: Address of the manager to remove

renounceRole(bytes32,address).details: Revokes `role` from the calling account. Roles are often managed via {grantRole} and {revokeRole}: this function's purpose is to provide a mechanism for accounts to lose their privileges if they are compromised (such as when a trusted device is misplaced). If the calling account had been revoked `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must be `callerConfirmation`. May emit a {RoleRevoked} event.

params.allocationId: ID of the allocation to revoke

returns._0: success Whether the revocation was successful

revokeRole(bytes32,address).details: Revokes `role` from `account`. If `account` had been granted `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role. May emit a {RoleRevoked} event.

upgradeToAndCall(address,bytes).details: Upgrade the implementation of the proxy to `newImplementation`, and subsequently execute the function call encoded in `data`. Calls {_authorizeUpgrade}. Emits an {Upgraded} event.
